intro: Anomalesia cunonia, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
